head: chocolate stout cake
tail: start by preheating the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and greasing and flouring two 9-inch round cake pans

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: In a separate bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: In a large bowl or stand mixer, beat butter, vegetable oil, dark brown sugar, and white sugar until light and fluffy

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Mix in sour cream and vanilla extract

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Gradually add dry ingredients, alternating with cooled stout mixture, until just combined

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans and tap them on the counter to remove air bubbles

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the cakes spring back lightly when touched

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 20 to 30 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Once cooled, place one cake layer on a serving platter and spread about 1 cup of frosting on top

head: chocolate stout cake
tail: Place the remaining cake layer on top and pour the remaining frosting over the cake, smoothing it over the top and sides until completely frosted
